author: english.ahram.org.eg
title: Formula One: Sainz set for Russian GP start - Omni Sports - Sports
text:
Carlos Sainz has been passed fit to take part in Sunday’s Russian Grand Prix following his high-speed crash during final practice on Saturday.
A medical examination by doctors representing the sport’s ruling body, the International Motoring Federation (FIA) gave the 21-year-old Spaniard approval to race, if his Toro Rosso team decide to run him.
A statement from the team said they will give Sainz a car and he will line up for the start of the race.
Sainz escaped unhurt after losing control of his car under braking at more than 300 kph at Turn 13 of the Sochi Autodrom where he speared into the barriers.
(For .)
